DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose study expand research effect physical activity basal metabolic rate ( BMR ) healthy postmenopausal woman , compare effect long-term habitual exercise result shorter-term ( 16 week ) train program . The investigator measure BMR indirect calorimetry normalize across subject body size ( fat free mass ) level aerobic fitness ( VO2MAX ) . Two group compare : intervention group ( previous participation regular exercise , newly enrol study 's 16 week training program ) , long-term athlete group ( engage least 5 hour exercise per week past 10 year longer ) . A secondary aim generate equation prediction BMR fat free mass physically active postmenopausal woman , applied hypothesis biological anthropology . The investigator expect find baseline , control fat free mass VO2MAX , long-term group significantly high BMR intervention group . At 16 week investigator expect change BMR long-term group , BMR increase intervention group . At time , investigator expect find completing train regimen , intervention group BMR similar long-term athlete .
DOC.brief_title: Physical Activity Basal Metabolic Rate Postmenopausal Women
DOC.criteria: naturally postmenopausal ( i.e . nonsurgically ) / > 1 year since last menstruation FSH > 30 mIU/ml estradiol17β < 25 pg/ml smoker , abuser alcohol/other drug hypo hyperthyroid ( serum TSH < 0.3 > 5.5 microU/ml , respectively ) underweight severely obese ( BMI < 18.5 > 35 kg/m2 , respectively ) weight instability within past six month ( ± > 5 % body weight ) hormone replacement therapy within past six month history metabolic , respiratory cardiovascular disease high blood pressure contraindication maximal aerobic testing determine PARQ questionnaire physician 's examination
